si

Portal is a certified "classic" game! Even though it was released in 2007, the community still loves this game! I played it recently again and I fully understand why this game is called a "classic".
The story can be described as: You are the test subject and you have to solve several puzzles while a robotic voice comments on your progress and leads you through your whole playthrough to find something "unusual".
You are only equipped with a portal gun and the puzzles require some time of thinking. I had a lot of fun to find my way through the different puzzles. The more you progress the more difficult they get. The graphics might be old school, but it still looks good for that time. The controls and humor were smooth, so I enjoyed playing it! 
If you enjoy puzzle games and you enjoyed the mechanics of the Half Life games, you will definitely enjoy playing this game!

Genuinely one of the best games you can ever play. IMO it's much better in terms of gameplay than portal 2 since it's much simpler so Valve had to get alittle more creative with their map design. It's levels are also much smaller so it's more about actually figuring out the puzzle rather than scouring every corner of the map to see some random portal wall 15 miles away you missed which happened multiple times in Portal 2. 

My only problem with this game is it isn't very long but it's the definition of short and sweet. 10/10.

Valve learn to count to 3 ffs and resurrect Portal, Half Life (where we don't need a £500 proprietary device to play it) and Left 4 Dead.

I recently bought Portal on PC (originally having it on the Xbox 360) to relive the experience.  Even after 10 years it's still good.  I would definitely urge you to buy this game (and Portal 2) if you haven't yet.  (If you are going to buy both, get the bundle.  It'll save you 5 bucks.)

Portal and Portal 2 are pretty much perfect games.  Like everyone, I really wish Steam would do a Portal 3. Maybe from Ratman's perspective?  These are some of my favorite games. My two sons love them, too.  Cannot recommend highly enough!

"Portal" ist ein kurzes aber sehr gutes Puzzle Spiel. Die Tests sind zwar etwas leicht aber trotzdem sehr gut. Dazu ist die Atmosphäre perfekt. Man fühlt sich sehr einsam da keine einzige menschliche Stimme zu hören ist und "GLaDOS" die einzige ist die man hört. Die Musik verstärkt die Atmosphäre gut und die Story ist meiner Meinung nach das Beste von allen.

it was pretty hard but i like a challenge and the story is really good
